Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)

justification: Kawasaki disease is a rare but serious condition that causes inflammation in the walls of blood vessels throughout the body. It primarily affects children under the age of 5. The classic symptoms of Kawasaki disease are prolonged fever, rash, conjunctivitis, swollen lymph nodes, red, swollen hands and feet, and red, cracked lips. While foot edema is not a typical symptom of Kawasaki disease, it can occur as a result of the inflammation in the blood vessels. Additionally, pyuria (pus in the urine) is not typically associated with Kawasaki disease.}, {diagnosis: Urinary tract infection (UTI)

justification: UTIs are a common cause of pyuria and fever. While conjunctivitis and foot edema are not typical symptoms of a UTI, they could be caused by other factors or could be unrelated.}, {diagnosis: Viral infection

justification: Many viral infections can cause fever, conjunctivitis, and swelling. Foot edema is less common but can occur in some cases. Pyuria is not typically associated with viral infections.}, {diagnosis: Allergic reaction

justification: Allergic reactions can cause a wide range of symptoms, including conjunctivitis, swelling, and skin rash. Fever and pyuria are less common but can occur in some cases.}, {diagnosis: Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS)

justification: SJS is a rare, serious disorder of the skin and mucous membranes. Its usually a reaction to a medication or an infection. SJS causes flu-like symptoms, followed by a painful red or purplish rash that spreads and blisters. Pyuria and foot edema can occur as complications of SJS.}, {diagnosis: Toxic shock syndrome (TSS)

justification: TSS is a rare, life-threatening condition caused by toxins produced by certain bacteria. It can cause fever, rash, conjunctivitis, low blood pressure, and organ damage. Foot edema and pyuria are not typical symptoms of TSS but could occur as complications.}, {diagnosis: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)

justification: IBD, including Crohns disease and ulcerative colitis, can cause a variety of symptoms, including fever, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and weight loss. Conjunctivitis and foot edema are extraintestinal manifestations of IBD that can occur. Pyuria is not typically associated with IBD but could be a sign of a UTI or other complications.}, {diagnosis: Autoimmune disease

justification: Autoimmune diseases, such as lupus and rheumatoid arthritis, occur when the bodys immune system attacks its own tissues. These diseases can cause a wide range of symptoms, including fever, fatigue, joint pain, and skin rashes. Conjunctivitis and foot edema can also occur. Pyuria is not typically associated with autoimmune diseases but could be a sign of a UTI or other complications.}, {diagnosis: Malignancy

justification: While rare, certain types of cancer can cause a combination of these symptoms. For example, leukemia can cause fever, fatigue, and increased risk of infections, which could manifest as pyuria and conjunctivitis. Foot edema could be a sign of a blood clot or other complications.}, {diagnosis: Drug reaction

justification: Certain medications can cause a wide range of side effects, including fever, rash, conjunctivitis, swelling, and organ damage. Pyuria could be a sign of kidney damage caused by a drug reaction.}
